title: Hypergeometric Basics
body: You are president of an on-campus special events organization. You need a committee of seven students to plan a special birthday party for the president of the college. Your organization consists of 18 women and 15 men. You are interested in the number of men on your committee, particularly, the probability that the committee has more than four men. This is a hypergeometric problem because you are choosing your committee from two groups (men and women).
